subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Bootstrapping vs. Venture Capital
description: A fast breakdown of Bootstrapping vs. Venture Capital for builders.

hook.text: Basecamp built a multi-million-dollar business with zero outside funding. Uber raised $25 billion. Both 'worked.'

buildup.text: Bootstrapping means funding growth through revenue. You keep full control but grow slower.

discovery.text: VC money buys speed and scale but comes with board seats, dilution, and pressure to exit within 7â€“10 years.

twist.text: The dirty secret: most VC-backed startups return nothing to founders. The median VC outcome is a loss.

climax.text: Mailchimp, Spanx, and Craigslist all bootstrapped to billions. VC isn't the only path to massive scale.

punchline.text: VC is rocket fuel. Bootstrap is solar power. Pick your engine.

quiz.question: What is a key trade-off of taking venture capital?
options: You gain speed and scale but lose some control and ownership
You must go public within five years of funding
You can no longer make decisions without board approval
